contentrichtext.text: [[File:Paul Gouin.JPG|thumb|right|Paul Gouin]] '''Paul Gouin''' (May 20, 1898 – December 4, 1976) was a politician in [[Quebec]], [[Canada]]. was the son of [[Lomer Gouin]] and the grandson of [[Honoré Mercier]]. ==Life and career== He was born in [[Montreal]]. He fought in [[World War I]] as a tank commander, studied at [[Université Laval]], and was admitted to the [[Barreau du Quebec|bar of Quebec]] in 1920. Dissatisfied with the direction of the [[Quebec Liberal Party]], he helped found the [[Action libérale nationale]] party on June 6, 1934. He soon formed an alliance with [[Maurice Duplessis]]'s [[Conservative Party of Quebec (historical)|Quebec Conservative Party]] to contest the [[Quebec general election, 1935|1935 provincial election]]. Gouin withdrew his support from Duplessis on June 18, 1936, but most members of the ALN caucus sided with Duplessis and joined with his Conservative caucus to formally merge into the [[Union Nationale (Quebec)|Union Nationale]] party, which not long afterwards won the [[Quebec general election, 1936|1936 election]]. He re-formed the [[Action libérale nationale]] and became its leader on July 24, 1938. However, the ALN did poorly in the [[Quebec general election, 1939|1939 election]], winning only 4.5% of the popular vote and no seats, and soon disbanded. He helped found the [[Bloc populaire canadien]] in 1942, but left it in early 1944 when [[André Laurendeau]] was chosen to lead the Quebec wing of the party. In 1952 he succeeded [[Madame Athanase David]] as the President of the [[Montreal Festivals]], a post he held through 1956. ==See also== * [[Politics of Quebec]] * [[Quebec general elections]] * [[Timeline of Quebec history]] ==External links== * {{QuebecMNAbio|gouin-paul-3495}} {{s-start}} {{s-par|ca-qc}} {{succession box| before=[[Walter Reed|Walter Reed (Liberal)]]| years=[[Quebec general election, 1935|1935]]-[[Quebec general election, 1936|1936]]| after=[[Adhémar Raynault|Adhémar Raynault (Union Nationale)]]| title=[[Legislative Assembly of Quebec|MLA]], District of [[L'Assomption (provincial electoral district)|L'Assomption]] }} {{s-end}} {{Authority control|VIAF=38032418}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Gouin, Paul | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Canadian politician | DATE OF BIRTH = May 20, 1898 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = December 4, 1976 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Gouin, Paul}} [[Category:1898 births]] [[Category:1976 deaths]] [[Category:Action libérale nationale MNAs]] [[Category:Quebec political party leaders]]
